input_sentence: if ego vehicle is turning left and other vehicle is going to turn right or other vehicle is onto the oncoming lane then in this case ego shall always yield to other vehicle provided there is no relevent traffic light for ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on the oncoming lane
Traffic light is relevant for ego

temporal_relations.description: If ego is turning left and (other is turning right OR other is on oncoming lane) AND no relevant traffic light, then ego must yield

lexicon.other_on_oncoming: Other vehicle is on oncoming lane
lexicon.light_relevant: Traffic light is relevant for ego

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: turning_left(ego)
   - ap_2: turning_right(other)
   - ap_3: on_oncoming_lane(other)
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with related_object]
   - ap_5: relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) [relational predicate with related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: turning_left(ego) & (turning_right(other) | on_oncoming_lane(other)) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G (turning_left(ego) & (turning_right(other) | on_oncoming_lane(other)) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: turning_left(ego)
   - ap_2: turning_right(other)
   - ap_3: on_oncoming_lane(other)
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with related_object]
   - ap_5: relevant_for(traffic_light,ego) [relational predicate with related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: turning_left(ego) & (turning_right(other) | on_oncoming_lane(other)) & ~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" or "Globally" that the entire implication must hold.
- The antecedent (left side of `->`) contains three predicates connected by `&` (and):
  - `turning_left(ego)` translates to "the ego vehicle is turning left"
  - `turning_right(other)` translates to "the other vehicle is turning right"
  - `on_oncoming_lane(other)` translates to "the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane"
  - The `|` (or) between the last two predicates indicates either condition can satisfy this part
  - `~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)` translates to "the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle"
- The consequent (right side of `->`) contains `yield(ego,other)` which translates to "the ego vehicle yields to the other vehicle"
- The entire formula is an implication (`->`) meaning "if...then" relationship

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is turning left and (the other vehicle is turning right or the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane) and the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is turning left and (the other vehicle is turning right or the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane) and the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

  - `turning_right(other)` translates to "the other vehicle is turning right"
  - `on_oncoming_lane(other)` translates to "the other vehicle is on the oncoming lane"
  - The `|` (or) between the last two predicates indicates either condition can satisfy this part
  - `~relevant_for(traffic_light,ego)` translates to "the traffic light is not relevant for the ego vehicle"
- The consequent (right side of `->`) contains `yield(ego,other)` which translates to "the ego vehicle yields to the other vehicle"
- The entire formula is an implication (`->`) meaning "if...then" relationship

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
